reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is good looking with its 2.5D style, and great stealth gameplay, wouldn't put it in the hard category but hopefully that will change in the full release, also the game time at the moment is short, as you can see in the graph on the store page, there is only one level with on character, but this is just the begging and if you want to invest in it now and help the game go ahead, there isn't anything bad about the game and i actually had fun playing it for the small time it provided me, will play this more the more they add.

More info at: KSalue[www.ksalue.com]

http://youtu.be/Q0hP3nEXBxs
voteText: 37 of 55 people (67%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Children of Liberty has the potential to be one of the most unique games in recent years. The art style is unlike anything I have seen before and reminds me of the awesome Disney movies I watched when I was young.

This game is ALPHA..which makes a review" quite difficult. With the market changing and more alphas/betas going up for sale
date: I feel that it is fair to write my opinion on whether or not this is a good purchase.\n\nWhile the game does not have much content currently
recommended: you can see the framework for something amazing being designed. Devs are actively working on the game and recently released an update.\n\nIf you want to support the indie scene and enjoy playing Alpha games during development
hoursPlayed: this is a must buy. I did an interview with the developer which is really informative to the work they do on this game"
votesTotal: 22 of 31 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCurrently very buggy, but also very early access. It's not near a full game yet, but it has promise and it seems like the developers are actively working on the game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

aug, 20th 2014, ver EX8 (8/5/14)
1. choose 1280 x 720 (unchecked window mode), display not auto centered.
2. got a couple of check points, hit ESC, back to main menu with no continue, load last checkpoint or save game button.

general recommendation :
don't waste your money to buy any game at full price on early access stage. unless you got that from a cheap bundle like i did. you're buying a game to play with it, not to debug it.

I'd consider this game still in early ugly alpha stage.

UPDATE nov-11-2014

just remember that i have this game. so i check this page for an update. well, there's an (late) update EX9. so?

steam didn't blocking" me to update this game when i hit the PLAY button. I'm still playing with version EX8 with the same old errors and bugs. while other games "still" automatically "blocking" me from playing it if there's a new update.

after re-read this update EX9 information :
http://steamcommunity.com/games/264440/announcements/detail/175961814419682112

"..Thank you again
recommended:
and see you in October for EX10! .."

it's already november now. where's that EX10? or does it mean "October 2015"?

UPDATE DEC
voteText: this game name changed into blue in my library. it means
helpfulPercent: it required an update. ok fine
votesHelpful: i'll update this. the code name change into EX10 AND
votesTotal:
change it's title into

PLAY WAREHOUSE PROTOTYPE

since the gamedev admitting that this game still a prototype. well
votesFunny: all my previous comments should be remove. but
commentsCount: for historical reason. i'll keep it here.\n\nfor a prototype game
column16: i don't need to give any further comment about the game. well
column17: a prototype should be full of bugs & errors. and i wanna play a game
column18: not to test a game. i've pay for this. but they sell a prototype?!\n\ni'm uninstalling this game. if i'm not forget
column19: maybe i'll see this page again some time in late 2015 to check their progress."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHave they given up on this game?  It hasn't updated in over a year.  That sucks, it had potential, but I can't recommend this to anyone.  This isn't worth $0.10 cents so how could I in good faith tell someone to spend $10.00?
